forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 47. West northwest wind around 8 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 3 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As night cloaks Downtown San Francisco, the air is cool and clear, resting gently at a low of 47 degrees. The evening sky held its promise of clarity, providing glimpses of distant lights twinkling like stars lost in the embrace of urbanity. A gentle breeze from the west-northwest whispers through the streets, a soft caress that hints at the pleasant day ahead. 

As dawn breaks tomorrow, expect the sun to rise with intentions of warmth. The high will flirt with 59, gradually slipping into the mellow mid-50s as shadows stretch and the city awakens. With mostly sunny skies, the marine layer remains at bay, allowing the colors of the day to come alive. Dressing in layers would be prudent; a light jacket should serve well in the morning chill, while comfortable attire underneath will keep one nimble and at ease as the sun coaxes people out into the parks or toward the waterfront. Consider a simple stroll along the Embarcadero, where the soft hum of the city blends with the serene lapping of the bay. With such delightful conditions, it’s a perfect day to enjoy a cup of coffee outdoors, indulging in the art of people-watching as life unfolds in all its myriad forms.
